title: Sprint Plan: Your Demo Prep
description: This activity guides you through planning your remaining Sprint 1 work. Every question connects to your demo next Wednesday. Your downloaded responses become your sprint plan AND your demo preparation.

settings.skipNudgeMessage: This question directly prepares you for the demo. Are you sure you want to skip?

questions.prompt: Your demo next Wednesday is 30 minutes, handwritten, closed book. What does 'closed book' mean for how you should prepare?
options: Memorize your 5 Whys word for word
Internalize your learning so you can write about it from understanding, not memory
Write your answers in advance and practice copying them
It doesn't matter — the questions are easy
questions.hint: The demo tests whether you actually understand your own learning process — not whether you can recall specific words.
questions.explanation: The demo tests internalized understanding. You can't memorize your way through it because follow-up questions will probe your actual thinking. The best prep is doing real work this week and reflecting on it honestly.

questions.prompt: State your skill gap and the root cause you identified through your 5 Whys analysis. Write it as if explaining to someone who knows nothing about your situation. Be specific — 'communication skills' is too vague. What exactly is the gap, and what is actually causing it?
questions.placeholder: Example: My skill gap is initiating conversations in professional settings. Through my 5 Whys, I discovered the root cause isn't shyness — it's that I don't know what to say after the opening line, so I avoid starting conversations to avoid the awkward silence that follows...

questions.prompt: A good root cause from the 5 Whys is one that you can actually DO something about. Which of these is the best root cause?
options: 'I'm bad at public speaking' — because that's what I identified
'I never had good role models for public speaking' — because it explains the history
'I don't practice speaking in low-stakes settings because I only think of it when high-stakes situations arise' — because I can change this behavior
'My brain just doesn't work that way' — because some people are naturally better
questions.hint: Which answer gives you something specific to change THIS WEEK?
questions.explanation: A useful root cause is actionable — it points to a specific behavior or pattern you can change. 'I don't practice in low-stakes settings' is actionable: you can create low-stakes practice opportunities. The others are either too vague, backward-looking, or defeatist.

questions.prompt: Look at your 5 Whys chain from Week 2. At which 'why' (1st, 2nd, 3rd, etc.) did you identify something you can actually change? Write that specific 'why' and explain why it's the one where you have agency.
questions.placeholder: At my 3rd why, I found that... This is where I have agency because...

questions.prompt: For your demo, you need to show evidence of progress (or honest evidence of struggle). Which of these counts as strong evidence?
options: 'I watched 5 YouTube videos about my skill' — because I put in time

'I tried initiating 3 conversations this week. The first was awkward, the second went better because I prepared an opening question, the third I maintained for 5 minutes' — because it shows specific attempts and progression
'I feel more confident about my skill now' — because confidence matters
'I made a plan and stuck to it' — because following through shows discipline
questions.hint: Strong evidence is specific, observable, and shows change over time — not just effort or feelings.
questions.explanation: Strong evidence describes specific actions with observable outcomes that show progression. 'I tried 3 conversations and each went differently' is evidence. 'I watched videos' is activity. 'I feel confident' is perception. The demo rewards specificity.

questions.prompt: What 2-3 specific actions will you take between now and Wednesday Feb 11 to build demo evidence? For each action: What exactly will you do? When? How will you know if it worked?
questions.placeholder:
Action 1: [What] [When] [How I'll know]
Action 2: [What] [When] [How I'll know]
Action 3 (optional): ...

questions.prompt: What specific evidence will you bring to the demo? Remember: you can't bring notes. So the evidence needs to be experiences you'll remember. Describe 2-3 pieces of evidence you expect to have by Feb 11.
questions.placeholder: Evidence 1: I will be able to describe [specific situation] where I [specific action] and [specific result]...

questions.prompt: Which optional demo question are you leaning toward?
options: Option A: Rate my progress 1-10 with evidence — I have clear progress to defend
Option A: Rate my progress 1-10 with evidence — Even if limited progress, I can be honest about why
Option B: Describe a failure and what it taught me — I have a specific failure I learned from
Option B: Describe a failure and what it taught me — I haven't made much progress, but I can reflect on why
questions.hint: There's no wrong answer here. Pick the one you can answer most honestly.
questions.explanation: Both options reward honesty over performance. Option A works if you have specific evidence (even of limited progress). Option B works if you have a genuine failure you can analyze. Pick whichever lets you be most authentic. All answers are valid for this reflection question.

questions.prompt: Draft your answer to the REQUIRED demo question: 'Walk through your 5 Whys chain. At which why did you identify something you can actually change — a root cause where you have agency to make progress?' Write a rough version — you'll refine it through your learning log entries this week.
questions.placeholder: My skill gap is... I started asking why: [1st why]... [2nd why]... [continue]. At my [Nth] why, I found something I could change: ...

questions.prompt: Final honest check: What's the biggest risk to your demo performance right now? Is it that you haven't done enough work? That you've done work but can't articulate it? That your 5 Whys was shallow? Name the weakness and what you'll do about it this week.
questions.placeholder: My biggest risk is... I'll address it by...
